title: Variables
text: Represent their speed using variables. Kathy walks two miles per hour faster than Cheryl, so you can represent Kathy(k) as $$2+c$$, and you can represent Cheryl simply as c.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the representations of walkers(in variable form) by how long they take.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their monetary values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{4.8}\left(2+c\right)=8c$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug c into the original relationship between the walkers to find k.

title: Calculation
text: Kathy walks at 5 mph while Cheryl walks at 3.
